title: TypeScript seems allow BigInt as EnumMemeber key

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: A closed issue/PR that is archived due to age. Recommended to make a new issue

body:
### ðŸ’»

- [ ] Would you like to work on a fix?

### How are you using Babel?

Programmatic API (`babel.transform`, `babel.parse`)

### Input code

```ts
enum Foo { 0n = 1 }
```

```
> require('@babel/parser').parse('enum Foo { 0n = 1 }', {plugins:['typescript']})
Uncaught [SyntaxError: Unexpected token (1:11)
] {
  code: 'BABEL_PARSER_SYNTAX_ERROR',
  reasonCode: 'UnexpectedToken',
  loc: Position { line: 1, column: 11, index: 11 },
  pos: 11,
  syntaxPlugin: undefined
}
```

### Configuration file name

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Current and expected behavior

[TypeScript seems allow this](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play/?ssl=1&ssc=20&pln=1&pc=1#code/KYOwrgtgBAYg9nKBvKAGEUC8UCMUC+QA)

When use illegal key for example `enum Foo { /x/i = 1 }`, the error message also says `The left-hand side of an assignment expression must be a variable or a property access.` I think BigInt is allowed.

### Environment

  System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.19045
  Binaries:
    Node: 22.14.0 - ~\AppData\Local\fnm_multishells\18348_1747897133071\node.EXE
    Yarn: 4.9.1 - D:\npm\yarn.CMD
    npm: 9.1.2 - ~\AppData\Local\fnm_multishells\18348_1747897133071\npm.CMD
    bun: 1.2.2 - ~\.bun\bin\bun.EXE
  npmPackages:
    @babel/code-frame: 7.27.1 => 7.27.1
    @babel/generator: 7.27.1 => 7.27.1
    @babel/parser: 7.27.2 => 7.27.2
    @babel/types: 7.27.1 => 7.27.1
    eslint: 9.27.0 => 9.27.0
    jest: 30.0.0-alpha.7 => 30.0.0-alpha.7
